conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes the ABCDA cycle with known quantities $P_1$, $P_2$, $V_1$, $V_2$, and temperature at state A is $T_0$.
The image shows a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram of a cyclic process for an ideal gas with points A, B, C, D and a horizontal line at constant pressure.
Identify the path from state D to state A as AD.
Determine the work done along path AD using $W = \int_{V_D}^{V_A} P \, dV$.
Since pressure is constant at $P_2$, work done is $W = P_2(V_1 - V_2)$.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings when transitioning from state D to state A is 6 x 10^3 J.
